title: Insecure Deserialization Boilerplate
content: Insecure deserialization leads to remote code execution, replay attacks, and privilege escalation. Prevent this by not accepting serialized objects from untrusted sources and implementing integrity checks.

title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Boilerplate
content: XSS vulnerabilities occur when applications include untrusted data in a web page without proper validation or escaping. To prevent XSS, validate and sanitize user input and use Content Security Policy (CSP).

title: Sensitive Data Exposure Boilerplate
content: Sensitive data exposure occurs when applications do not adequately protect sensitive information. Use encryption, both in transit and at rest, to protect sensitive data and limit data exposure through proper access controls.

title: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities Boilerplate
content: Using vulnerable components can lead to significant security risks. Regularly update components, monitor CVE reports, and use dependency check tools to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities.

title: Security Misconfiguration Boilerplate
content: Security misconfiguration is the most common vulnerability. It occurs due to insecure default configurations, incomplete configurations, or open cloud storage. Regularly update systems, disable unnecessary features, and apply security patches promptly.

title: Injection Vulnerability Boilerplate
content: Injection vulnerabilities occur when untrusted data is sent to an interpreter as part of a command or query. This can lead to data leaks or unauthorized actions. Ensure proper input validation and use parameterized queries to prevent injection attacks.

title: Broken Access Control Boilerplate
content: Broken access control vulnerabilities allow users to act outside of their intended permissions. Enforce access control checks consistently, use role-based access controls, and deny access by default to prevent unauthorized access.

title: XML External Entities (XXE) Boilerplate
content: XXE vulnerabilities arise when XML input containing a reference to an external entity is processed by a weakly configured parser. To prevent XXE, disable DTDs (Document Type Definitions) and use libraries that are not susceptible to XXE attacks.

title: Broken Authentication Boilerplate
content: Broken authentication vulnerabilities allow attackers to compromise passwords, keys, or session tokens, or exploit other implementation flaws to assume other users' identities. Implement multi-factor authentication and secure password storage to mitigate these risks.

title: Insufficient Logging and Monitoring Boilerplate
content: Insufficient logging and monitoring allows attackers to further their attacks without being detected. Implement comprehensive logging, ensure logs are monitored and analyzed, and establish an incident response plan.
